WordPress as a Collaboration Platform

Posted on May 08, 2012 by Benjamin J. Balter
Today countless teams are using WordPress to drive collaboration and facilitate inter-team communication. This presentation — given at the May WordPress DC Meetup — showcases some of the creative ways companies and organizations are using WordPress as the central hub of their day-to-day workflow: To organize and collaboratively edit documents and other non-web content, track and communicate their team’s progress with one another, and extend WordPress to work with their existing tools and practices *Click on the slides below to begin, then press the left/right keyboard arrows to navigate*

View Full Screen
Recording of the presentation (starts at the 10:00 mark):
http://www.ustream.tv/recorded/22454841
## Plugins Mentioned * [WP Document Revisions][1] * [Edit Flow][2] * [Members][3] * [Advanced Custom Fields][4] * [Display Custom Fields][5] * [Count Shortcode][6] * [Faceted Search Widget][7] * [Custom Taxonomy Generator][8] [1]: http://ben.balter.com/2011/08/29/wp-document-revisions-document-management-version-control-wordpress/ [2]: http://editflow.org [3]: http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/members/ [4]: http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/advanced-custom-fields/ [5]: http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wp-display-custom-fields/ [6]: http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/count-shortcode/ [7]: http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/faceted-search-widget/ [8]: http://themergency.com/generators/wordpress-custom-taxonomy/
